levels.description: etcd: Shared configuration has been learned by the local node.
levels.details: All shared configuration has been synchronized to the local node.
levels.cause: All shared configuration has been synchronized to the local node. Once the local node has joined any backend clusters, it may be safely added to DNS to allow it to start providing service. The previous issued alarm has been cleared
levels.effect: Shared configuration is up to date on the local node.

levels.description: etcd: Shared configuration has not been learned on the local node
levels.details: Some shared configuration has not been received at the local node yet.
levels.cause: Some shared configuration has not been received at the local node yet. If you have not uploaded all the shared config yet, this alarm will clear once that is done. You should not add the local node to DNS until this alarm clears.
levels.effect: The local node is still running with the state of the shared configuration data as it was prior to the last configuration data update.
levels.action: Monitor this alarm, and wait for it to clear. Shared configuration can take up to 30 seconds per node to percolate through the deployment. If the alarm doesn't clear in a timely fashion, contact your support representative.

levels.details: The config manager process has been restored to normal operation.
levels.cause: The config manager process has been restored to normal operation. The previously issued alarm has been cleared.
levels.effect: Changes to shared config will be applied to this node.

levels.details: Monit has detected that the local config manager process has failed. A restart will automatically be attempted. If this alarm does not clear, the config manager process may have been stopped or an unrecoverable failure may have occurred.
levels.cause: Monit has detected that the local config manager process has failed. A restart will automatically be attempted.
levels.effect: Changes to shared config will not be applied to this node.
levels.action: If this alarm does not clear, the config manager process may have been stopped or an unrecoverable failure may have occurred. Contact your support representative.
